sparse_to_dense will do what you want, you just have to index your data first. For your example, you would want

inputs, num_labels = [0,2], 4
indexedInputs = [[i, inputs[i]] for i in range(len(inputs))]
tf.sparse_to_dense(indexedInputs, [len(inputs),num_labels], 1)  # produces [[1,0,0,0], [0,0,1,0]]

body:
`sparse_to_dense` will do what you want, you just have to index your data first.  For your example, you would want

``` python
inputs, num_labels = [0,2], 4
indexedInputs = [[i, inputs[i]] for i in range(len(inputs))]
tf.sparse_to_dense(indexedInputs, [len(inputs),num_labels], 1)  # produces [[1,0,0,0], [0,0,1,0]]
```
